com.samskivert.depot.annotation

Annotation Type Computed


  • @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
 @Target(value={FIELD,TYPE})
public @interface Computed
    Marks a field as computed, meaning it is ignored for schema purposes and it does not directly correspond to a column in a table.

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      String fieldDefinition
      A non-empty value here is taken as literal SQL and used to populate the computed field.
      boolean required
      If this value is false, the field is not populated at all.
      Class<? extends PersistentRecord> shadowOf
      A computed record can shadow a concrete record, which causes any field the former has in common with the latter and which is not otherwise overriden to inherit its definition.

    • Element Detail

      • required

        public abstract boolean required
        If this value is false, the field is not populated at all.
        Default:
        true

      • fieldDefinition

        public abstract String fieldDefinition
        A non-empty value here is taken as literal SQL and used to populate the computed field.
        Default:
        ""

      • shadowOf

        public abstract Class<? extends PersistentRecord> shadowOf
        A computed record can shadow a concrete record, which causes any field the former has in common with the latter and which is not otherwise overriden to inherit its definition. The shadowed class may also be given at the field level. The purpose of shadowing is largely to avoid having to supply a FieldOverride when querying for objects that that contain large subsets of some other persistent object's fields -- in other words, when you use a computed entity to query only some of the columns from a table. The shadowed class must have been brought into the query using e.g. FromOverride or Join clauses. The referenced fields must be simple concrete columns in a table; they must themselves be computed or overridden or shadowing. TODO: Do in fact let the shadowed field be computed, overriden or shadowing.
        Default:
        com.samskivert.depot.PersistentRecord.class
